title: Quiz 9: Helminthic Infections
description: Comprehensive quiz on Intestinal Worms: Roundworms, Hookworms, Tapeworms, and Hydatidosis.

questions.question: Which intestinal worm is most common in school children and is characterized by intense perianal itching at night?
questions.explanation: Threadworms (Pinworms) migrate to the anus at night to lay eggs, causing severe itching.

questions.question: What is the hallmark clinical sign of a heavy Hookworm infection?
questions.explanation: Hookworms suck blood from the intestinal wall (0.03ml per worm/day), leading to severe pallor and anaemia.

questions.question: The infective larvae of Hookworm enter the human body by ___BLANK___ through the ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Hookworm filariform larvae in moist soil penetrate bare skin (usually the feet).

questions.question: Which of the following are potential complications of a heavy Roundworm (Ascaris) infection? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Ascaris can physically block the gut, steal nutrients, and irritate the lungs as they migrate.

questions.question: To reach maturity, Roundworm (Ascaris) larvae must pass through the lungs and trachea before being swallowed back into the gut.
questions.explanation: This unique migration phase is necessary for the larvae to develop before returning to the small intestine.

questions.question: Match the Tapeworm type with its primary source of infection:
questions.explanation: Taeniasis comes from undercooked meat; Hydatid disease comes from accidental ingestion of dog tapeworm eggs.

questions.question: Which tapeworm is particularly dangerous because its embryos can penetrate the intestinal wall and cause epilepsy by forming cysts in the brain?
questions.explanation: Taenia solium (Pork Tapeworm) can lead to neurocysticercosis, causing seizures and other CNS issues.

questions.question: What is the definitive host for the tapeworm that causes Hydatid disease (Echinococcosis)?
questions.explanation: Hydatidosis is a zoonotic disease of dogs; humans are only accidental final hosts.
questions.hint: Turkana communities are at high risk due to close contact.

questions.question: In the image below, identify the parasite whose life cycle involves 'Soil -> Bare Feet -> Lungs -> Gut':
questions.explanation: The description perfectly matches the unique skin-entry lifecycle of the Hookworm.
questions.hint: Look for the skin entry point.

questions.question: Arrange the preventive measures for Tapeworm in order of priority (source to table):

items.text: Proper disposal of human faeces in latrines
Washing hands after handling raw meat

questions.explanation: Control starts with stopping environmental contamination, followed by safety checks, and finally individual food safety.
